metadata.author: Microsoft - support@microsoft.com
metadata.comments: Solution template for Oracle Cloud Infrastructure

metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
resource group name where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
subscription id where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

connectorUiConfig.title: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (via CCP) – Preview
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) data connector provides the capability to ingest OCI Logs from [OCI Stream](https://docs.oracle.com/iaas/Content/Streaming/Concepts/streamingoverview.htm) into Microsoft Sentinel using the [OCI Streaming REST API](https://docs.oracle.com/iaas/api/#/streaming/streaming/20180418).

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

customs.name: OCI Streaming API access
customs.description: Access to the OCI Streaming API through a API Signing Keys is required.

instructionSteps.title: Connect to OCI Streaming API to start collecting Event logs in Microsoft Sentinel
instructionSteps.description:
1) Log in to the OCI console and access the navigation menu.
2) In the navigation menu, go to "Analytics & AI" → "Streaming".
3) Click "Create Stream".
4) Select an existing "Stream Pool" or create a new one.
5) Enter the following details:
   - "Stream Name"
   - "Retention"
   - "Number of Partitions"
   - "Total Write Rate"
   - "Total Read Rate" (based on your data volume)
6) In the navigation menu, go to "Logging" → "Service Connectors".
7) Click "Create Service Connector".
8) Enter the following details:
   - "Connector Name"
   - "Description"
   - "Resource Compartment"
9) Select the "Source": "Logging".
10) Select the "Target": "Streaming".
11) (Optional) Configure "Log Group", "Filters", or use a "custom search query" to stream only the required logs.
12) Configure the "Target" by selecting the previously created stream.
13) Click "Create".
14) Follow the documentation to create a [Private Key and API Key Configuration File](https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/API/Concepts/apisigningkey.htm).

parameters.label: Stream OCID
parameters.placeholder: Provide the OCI Stream OCID (E.g. ocid1.stream.oc1..xxxxxxEXAMPLExxxxxx)
parameters.name: streamId

parameters.label: Service Endpoint Base URL
parameters.placeholder: Provide the Service Endpoint Base URL: (https://cell-1.streaming.ap-hyderabad-1.oci.oraclecloud.com)
parameters.name: serviceEndpointBaseUrl

parameters.label: Partition Id
parameters.placeholder: Provide the Partition Id. (E.g. 0 or 1 or 2)
parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: The partition ID uses zero-based indexing. For example, if a stream has 3 partitions, the valid partition IDs are 0, 1, or 2.

parameters.label: Pass Phrase
parameters.placeholder: Provide the pass phrase for the Pem File Content. (Optional)
parameters.name: passPhrase

parameters.label: Fingerprint
parameters.placeholder: Provide the fingerprint for the Pem File Content. (E.g. 12:34:56:78:90:AB:CD:EF:GH:IJ:KL:MN:OP)
parameters.name: publicFingerprint

connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) data connector provides the capability to ingest OCI Logs from [OCI Stream](https://docs.oracle.com/iaas/Content/Streaming/Concepts/streamingoverview.htm) into Microsoft Sentinel using the [OCI Streaming REST API](https://docs.oracle.com/iaas/api/#/streaming/streaming/20180418).

instructionSteps.title: Connect to OCI Streaming API to start collecting Event logs in Microsoft Sentinel
instructionSteps.description:
1) Log in to the OCI console and access the navigation menu.
2) In the navigation menu, go to "Analytics & AI" → "Streaming".
3) Click "Create Stream".
4) Select an existing "Stream Pool" or create a new one.
5) Enter the following details:
   - "Stream Name"
   - "Retention"
   - "Number of Partitions"
   - "Total Write Rate"
   - "Total Read Rate" (based on your data volume)
6) In the navigation menu, go to "Logging" → "Service Connectors".
7) Click "Create Service Connector".
8) Enter the following details:
   - "Connector Name"
   - "Description"
   - "Resource Compartment"
9) Select the "Source": "Logging".
10) Select the "Target": "Streaming".
11) (Optional) Configure "Log Group", "Filters", or use a "custom search query" to stream only the required logs.
12) Configure the "Target" by selecting the previously created stream.
13) Click "Create".
14) Follow the documentation to create a [Private Key and API Key Configuration File](https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/API/Concepts/apisigningkey.htm).

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: Please refer to the following before installing the solution:

• Review the solution Release Notes

• There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) solution provides the capability to ingest OCI Logs from OCI Stream into Microsoft Sentinel using the OCI Streaming REST API.

Underlying Microsoft Technologies used:

This solution takes a dependency on the following technologies, and some of these dependencies either may be in Preview state or might result in additional ingestion or operational costs:

  1. Azure Monitor HTTP Data Collector API

  2. Azure Functions

Data Connectors: 1

Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel | Learn more about Solutions
